page.title: 04NORTH TURTON PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: There are seven councillors on the North Turton Parish{Council}which is the minor local{government}authority covering Edgworth,Chapeltown and Belmont.Two people represent Belmont.The elections are held every four years. Matters discussed at the meetings include{planning}applications,village facilities and any problems in the area such as aspects of road safety,upkeep of walls,foot paths and street lights.The council puts the local point of view on such matters as public transport,education and recreation.They have built an extension to the school for use as storage space by village {organisations}.They established Belmont Youth Club and have fought to keep low bus fares for old people.
